title: Understanding the Hollow Cathode Lamp
text: The hollow cathode lamp is crucial in atomic absorption spectroscopy. It emits light at specific wavelengths that correspond to the absorption lines of the element being analyzed.

title: Why Specific Wavelengths?
text: Each element absorbs light at specific wavelengths. The hollow cathode lamp is designed to emit these specific wavelengths, allowing for accurate detection of the element.

hintAnswer: To provide a specific wavelength of light that is absorbed by the metal ions
